title: super old board 820-2249, can't boot into OS.
message:
I know I know, you guys would say "come on man give up on this 10 years old shit"

but when this is a 2.6ghz board and customer is willing to pay 200 for it, I can't stop my greed,lol.


anyway, the problem is that the board can't boot into the OS. thought it's the common NVVIDIA chipset problem,replaced with new one, still the same thing.(replaced so many for this G84 models, nothing can go wrong during the BGA process I think)

then i hold "command"+"v" , to see the boot sequence details.

it gets stuck at the lines

yukon:Ethernet address 00:22:41:29:a6:d8
AppleYukon2: RxRingsize <=1024, TxRingSize 256, RX_MAX_LE 2014, TX_MAX_LE 768, ST_MAX_LE 3328


any thoughts please?

title: super old board 820-2249, can't boot into OS.
message: Boot in safe mode so drivers don't load.  I still suspect a GPU/VRAM issue.
